Let me show you that lunchtime poll topic, Veronica.
I rarely listen to Neanderthals like Kurt Kelly bu-ut he said you were bent over like a coffee table with Kurt going in one end and Ram coming in the other. Pardon the pun.
Westerburg? A happy family?
Sorry Veronica.
That's okay. Your Mom said you had a big date. Heck, I'd probably skip my own birthday party for a date.
Oh Ronnie, you have to look at what I dug up the other day.
May Heather Chandler rest in peace even though she committed suicide.
I don't believe it. I'm winning.
I missed you. I know I'm not as, as exciting as your other friends.
Ronnie, I'm still a virgin.
Ronnie!
Hey, you're not settling for the two shots are you? Knock me out girl.
Nice guys finish last. I should know.
But I thought...
Oh great. Here comes Heather.
Thanks. I just got it last night at the Limited. Totally blew my allowance.
If I got that money, I'd give it all to the poor. Every cent.
In my heart, Heather's still alive.
Like last night, Veronica?
You did last night.
I don't know. He was really detailed.
Oh great. Here comes Heather.
That's easy. I'd just slide that wad over to my father. He's like one of the top brokers in the state.
Man, in two days, my dad could double my money. Triple it.
But that's the Famine Fund money.
I'm not belittling the Famine Fund Peter, but we're talking teen suicide!
Don't worry about it, Veronica, sit down. That funeral yesterday must have been really rough.
It's more tasteful than it sounds.
HEATHER CHANDLER drags VERONICA down a cafeteria lane.
VERONICA confronts HEATHER CHANDLER.
VERONICA and HEATHER CHANDLER continue their conversation chugging through another busy cafeteria lane.
Did you see that? Heather Number One looked right at us.
I told you she knew my name.
I'd change my life. New clothes.
Hurry up, we're going to get caught.
We're on Candid Camera, dudes. I can feel it.
Leave him alone, Kurt.
It's Friday.....
Yeah, these things are pretty artificial, but at least we all get out of class...
The boiler room.
It must be love.
Taking a hooker to the Pyramids on the last day of Mankind. You sentimental old fart.
No seriously, I'd probably go to the Pyrimads. With a girl.
Where you going to get a girl, stud?
Geez, forget it.
Sit and spin.
Cut it out!
Okay, okay, you like to suck big dicks.
I like to suck big dicks. Mmm-mm!
Heavy Metaler MATT grins.
Heavy Metaler CLYDE turns from his friend MATT.
HEATHER DUKE and a vegged out HEATHER MCNAMARA stop sauntering through the parking lot to contemplate Veronica's hiccuping car and its sparring occupants.
You get five million dollars but some Martians are going to zap you in two days. You hear that, Clyde?
Do I deliver or do I deliver?
Mellow out Geek. Man, I never should have brought you.
Does this have something to do with menstrual cramps and shit?
I think we should use the money for an End-of-the-world get-together.
I've got to get going, Veronica.
What?
I'm sorry about your friend. I thought she was your usual airhead bitch.
The ALL-OUT NERD lashes out.
If you want a good way to go out before the aliens land, get a lion from the zoo. Put a remote control bomb up its butt. When the lion starts tearing you up, press the bomb button.
Let's see some pussy!
What the fuck?
What the fuck?
What the fuck?
Cool.
Gross!
Greetings and salutations. Call me J.D. Are you a Heather?
Heather, your Mother's here.
Hey kid, isn't the prom coming up?
Any contestants worth mentioning?
You two....
Terrible thing. So will we get to meet this dark horse prom contender?
You two....
How was the funeral?
I don't know what you're talking about, honey, but can it wait a bit.
Turn that back on!
Are you trying to tell me it is not a troubled time for the nation's youth?
I'm lost. You don't get enough attention, you get too much attention.
Treated like human beings? Is that what you said little Miss Voice of a Generation? Just how do you think adults act with other adults? You think it's all just Doubles Tennis.
You'll live. Want some pate?
Your friend Jason Dean just stopped by. He seemed very concerned about you. He said he thinks you might try to kill yourself.
He says we should keep you away from sharp objects, closed garages, toxic...
Dinner! Veronica! Dinner!
Does she want a written invitation?
Veronica! Dinner!
Honey?
Honey, are you all right in there?
Oh God, I knew it! No, no! I want my baby back! I should have let you keep that job at the mall. I was just afraid of you coming home alone at night!
I made your favorite! Spaghetti!
Take a break Veronica, sit down.
So what was the first week of Spring Vacation withdrawl like?
Goddamn. Will somebody please tell me why I read this spy crap.
Oh yeah, that's it.
Take a break Veronica, sit down.
So what was the first day after Heather's suicide like?
Goddamn. Will somebody please tell me why I smoke these damn things?
Oh yeah, that's it.
Hey Veronica, how'd that Teenage Prevention T.V. Suicide thing go?
If we're not going to watch that program, can I put on the game?
I don't patronize bunny rabbits.
You have been depressed lately. Oh, he said this is for you.
Throw your coats on the bed, girls.
Veronica, this is Brad.
She loves to party.
Don't worry, we will. You're just so hot tonight. I can't control myself.
Hey Veronica Sawyer, barf on anybody's carpet lately?
What can I say? I was pretty broken up by Heather C.'s suicide. I needed somebody super-sensitive like Heather D.
She can't really talk right now.
That exam was so bogus.
Oh I know. Which exam?
Excellent. Did you girls bring your partying slippers?
So, are you a cheerleader?
You're pretty enough to be one.
It's so great to be able to talk to a girl and not have to ask "What's your major?" I hate that.
So when you go to college, what kind of subjects do you think you'll study?
So what do you say we head up to my room and have a real party. I've got the best Windham Hill C.D. collection in the dorm.
You're kidding. That pecker actually scored something on his own?
Excellent. Veronica, ever do cocaine?
Phil Collins? Are you sure he isn't drinking and driving?
Hey, don't run away now.
How's my little cheerleader? Now I know everyone at your high school isn't so uptight, come on.
Let's do it on the coats. It'll be excellent.
Save the speeches for Malcom X.
The chaotic hallway rumbles with beer cups and loud music.
BRAD has given up on conversation.

VERONICA storms into the hallway but slows down when she sees she's attracting attention. She notices an incited BRAD slither to the smiling DAVID who chats with some STUDENTS, HEATHER CHANDLER on his arm.
A steel faced HEATHER CHANDLER comes face-to-face with VERONICA.
VERONICA rises into view with tinges of vomit on her mouth.
Brad-man, Robinson's looking for you. He says he owes you for blow and he just got some product himself.
He's in Sheila's room, guy. Party up.
The fire in the trashcan is raging.
VERONICA charges into the alley. She whips around to face a screeching HEATHER CHANDLER. In back of VERONICA, the trashcan bellows like Mt. Vesuvius.
Any other Principal would take the same position. Keep things business as usual.
I let the kids go before lunch and the switchboard'll light up like a Christmas Tree.
Oh Christ.
Thank you, Ms. Fleming. Call me when the shuttle lands...Now is this Heather the cheerleader?
Damn. I'd be willing to go half a day for a cheerleader.
Done. I hate Mondays.

Shut up, Paul. I've seen a lot of bullshit--angel dust, switchblades, sexually perverse photography exhibits involving tennis racquets, but this suicide thing....I guess it's all on Pauline's wavelength.
Heather Chandler's not your everyday suicide. She was very popular.
That would be Heather Mcnamara.
Pauline, if you want a tryout for the school play....
The parents will be sympathetic, sir.
Let's just pack it in an hour early.
After every touchdown or whatever, they give each other a little slap on the bottom. It seems innocent...
I find it profoundly disturbing that we are told of a tragic destruction of youth and all we can talk about is adequate mourning times and misused vocabulary words.
The school, meaning both students and teachers, must revel in this revealing moment. I suggest we get everyone into the cafeteria and just talk. And feel. Together.
I said a circle you imbeciles! Forget it! Just sit down. I'm just so thrilled to be given an example of everything I've taught you. That example is Heather Chandler. I have the note!
I'll pass the suicide note around the room so you can feel its tragic beauty for yourself. Let us share together the feelings the suicide has spurred in us all. Who wants to begin?
Now, now, we're not here to rehash the coroner's report. Let's talk emotions.
That's very good Peter.
Dear Veronica, Heather was your soulmate.....Share.
Shut up.
Will you shut up! We were in a similar position Monday and I thoughtfully suggested that we get the students together for an unadulterated emotional outpouring.
Peter, kill the jukebox.
Could I have your attention?

Our school has been torn apart by tragedy. I'm here today to fuse it back together through love! I want everyone to clasp hands. We need to connect this cafeteria into one mighty circuit. Let's begin a new happiness!
Yo, what's the problem? I know you know how to hold hands. Ring-around-
Let's show the world Westerburg is a diverse happy home, not Suicide Central!
You know there's some people who say Westerburg is too weak and wimpy a school to be on T.V. Is that true?
No or Hell No?
I can't hear you....
Veronica, there you are!
You people are in charge of getting delegates from every clique in the school to be on the Whitney James Teenage Suicide Prevention T.V. Special.
I'm sure you'll work something out.
Everyone take their places on the stage!
Isn't this thrilling?!
What, the wine? I realize you're all under 21, but it seemed like such a perfect touch.
Could we get some more light up here?
Our schools have been torn apart by tragedy. Let's fuse them back together through love. Let's clasp hands and connect ourselves in one mighty circuit like a dove.
Let's begin a new happiness...
...with no more suicide...
No more problems....
Veronica! J.D. told me you committed suicide last night!
We have to talk.  Whether to kill yourself is one of the most important decisions a teenager has to make.
All right!
I heard it was really gnarly. She drank Liquid Plumber and Comet and stuff then she smashed....
Everyone in the shower!
Do you deliver or do you deliver?
Hey Dad, how was work today?

It was miserable. Some damn tribe of withered old bitches doesn't want us to terminate that fleabag hotel. All because Glenn Miller and his band once took a shit there. It's just like Kansas. Do you remember fucking Kansas?
Fucking Kansas. Gosh Pop, I almost forgot to introduce my girlfriend.
We beat the bitches.
Judge told em to slurp shit and die.
I put a Norwegian in the boiler room.
It's great to be alive!
I need some help with my homework...
The Save the Memorial Oak Tree Society. Showed those fucks.
Right, son.
I blame not Heather but rather a society that tells its youth that the answers are on the MTV video games. We must pray the other teenagers of Sherwood, Ohio, know the name of that "righteous dude"
It's Jesus Christ and he's in the book.
Eskimo.
Heather Duke underlined a lot of things in this copy of The Catcher in the Rye, but I believe the word Eskimo, underlined all by itself is the key to understanding Heather's pain.

On the surface, Heather Duke was the vivacious young lady we all knew her to be. But her soul was in Antartica, freezing with the knowledge of the way fellow teenagers can be cruel, the way parents can be unresponsive, and as she writes so eloquently in her suicide note, the way life can suck. We'll all miss Sherwood's little Eskimo. Let's hope she's rubbing noses with Jesus.
HEATHER MCNAMARA dips a big comb in the holy water basin and then combs out her hair. VERONICA breezes by.
One. Two. Three!
We were, uh, wondering if maybe you had some poems or artwork that Heather did that we could put in the Heather Chandler yearbook spread?
Take a look. We'll have a two page layout with her suicide note up here in the right hand corner.

Characters.Character: SQUAD CAR IN SCHOOL PARKING LOT

Replies.Reply: Two cops, MILNER and McCORD, smoke marijuana in a squad car already filled with smoke. After a coughing fit, MILNER shouts.
I heard it that time!
Another gunshot! From the woods!
Keep going until you hit the clearing!
Call in!
I heard something out there. I'm checking it out.
Think what I heard was just a stinking owl. All I got is two kids making out in the backseat of a car. Should I pry them apart?
What's the deal?
That's Kurt Kelly!
Oh my God, suicide? Why?
Oh man, they were fags!
Ah Jesus H. Fuck. Kurt was a Parade magazine Honorable Mention...
Wait a second. How did they shoot each other if we heard two separate sets of gunshots?
Oh the humanity.
Did you hear? School's cancelled today because Kurt and Ram killed themselves in a repressed homosexual suicide pact.
It looks like the teen suicide epidemic has hit home in Sherwood as the death toll at Westerburg High rockets to three.
Heather Chandler, Kurt Kelly, and Rupert "Ram" Sweeney all had good looks and popularity, but there's one thing they didn't have: Values, Ambition, and Hope.
It rained everyday of my Maui vacation, but hey, I didn't kill myself. I'm Whitney James, Commentary.
Ah please sit down.
I got a confession to make. My name used to be Heather, too.
People just don't take the name Heather seriously. They should, shouldn't they?
Oh, I was scared of the same thing, Heather.

I'm not knocking teen suicide. It's exciting stuff. My personal faves are those kids from loaded families grabbing the mike to whine how even though they bagged a B.M.W. on their birthday, they're still quote-unquote depressed. It's ridiculous. People who say money can't buy happiness don't know where to shop.
Stained with loserness. Oh, I like it. Can I use that. It'd be dynamite on interoffice memoranda.
Sure. Ciao.
Let's go for another take.
Thanks Whitney, but I hate to say it. It looks like you brought that rainy weather back with you.
Hell no!
HELL NO!
Oh yeah...
TIMES ARE MEAN FOR A TEEN--WE KNOW!
BUT THERE'S MORE THAN ONE WAY TO GO!
TEENAGE SUICIDE; DON'T DO IT!
Chandler fashion to various passers-by.

Veronica, I thought we lost you.
Teens talking it out on T.V.! Would it be pretentious of me to attach a videocassette of the show on my Princeton application?
This is excellent, but I thought we were going to get equal representation on this thind: Geeks, Gearheads...

VERONICA and PETER take in a panorama of attractive, clean-cut STUDENTS from various schools chatting near Wine and Cheese tables set up to the side of an impressive, elevated, circular stage. All STUDENTS are wearing pink armbands.
HEATHER MCNAMARA surreptitiously picks up a bottle of wine and with a sad expression, proceeds to down it.
Completely flabbergasted, VERONICA manages a light tone.
Sickened, VERONICA stumbles onto the studio floor. Studio lights suddenly pop on, momentarily blinding her. PAULINE grabs VERONICA by the arm and shouts into the air.
She sprints down the side of a road. Her bare feet pound against sharp pebbles.
wearing a BIGFUN T-shirt, pushes three dollars through the ticket window to a bored female cashier.
Bargain matinees are for the first show only.
Oh, I forgot.
I'd like that.

Oh sure, I'll bet even back when I went to school there were drugs, even sex, but they were simpler times. The Sherwood suicides tell the bitter truth of today's young. What a waste...Oh  VERONICA snaps off the T.V.
I know it's supposed to be funny that they never get off the island, but still, sometimes I feel like I'm on that island and Gilligan can be just so stupid sometimes.
But Skipper hates me....
The D.J. looks to the conference call box with exasperation.
Where's Heather going?
Now where's she going? Is somebody getting raped today on All My Children or what?
